summary: An internal email from AFGE Local 3148 to Bureau of Prisons employees at the Metropolitan Correctional Center following Jeffrey Epstein's death, providing guidance on media interaction, union rights, and procedures for dealing with investigations by BOP, OIG, and FBI.

persons.name: Lee Plourde
persons.context: Identified as the official media contact for the institution; employees are directed to refrain from speaking to media and refer inquiries to him.

events.title: Epstein's Death in Custody
events.description: Jeffrey Epstein was found dead in his cell at the Metropolitan Correctional Center, an event referred to as 'yesterdays incident' that has placed staff under intense scrutiny.

keyFacts: The document is a union email sent to BOP staff the day after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody.
It acknowledges the incident will cause significant backlash and places staff 'under a microscope.'
It instructs employees not to speak to the media and to direct all inquiries to Public Information Officer Lee Plourde.
It outlines union rights for employees, including the right to representation during questioning by BOP, OIA, OIG, or FBI.
It specifically warns that if questioned by the FBI, employees should 'immediately inform that you want an attorney.'
